{{About|the company co-founded by Madonna|the Florida-based film distributor|Maverick Entertainment Group}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox company | name = Maverick | logo = Maverick records.png | logo_size = | industry = [[Music industry|Music]]
[[Film industry|Film]]
[[Entertainment industry|Entertainment]] | foundation = 1992 | founder = [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]]
[[Frederick DeMann]]
Veronica "Ronnie" Dashev | location_city = [[Beverly Hills, California]], U.S. | key_people = | products = [[Management]], [[Music]], [[Entertainment]], [[Film]], [[Television program]], [[Music Video]] | homepage = http://maverick.com/ }} '''Maverick''' was an American entertainment company founded in 1992 by [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Frederick DeMann]], and Veronica "Ronnie" Dashev, and formerly owned and operated by [[Warner Music Group]]. It included a recording company (Maverick Records), a film production company (Maverick Films), book publishing, music publishing, a Latin record division (Maverick Musica), and a television production company. The first releases for the company were Madonna's 1992 coffee table publication ''[[Sex (book)|Sex]]'' and her studio album ''[[Erotica (Madonna album)|Erotica]]'', which were released simultaneously to great controversy.{{citation needed|date=January 2017}} DeMann was bought out of the company for a reported $20 million in 1998. [[Guy Oseary]] increased his stake in the company and took control as Chairman and CEO. Madonna and Dashev left in 2004 after a lawsuit between Maverick and Warner Music Group. ==History== Maverick Records was launched in April 1992 as a unit of the Maverick entertainment company. It was a joint venture between [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Frederick DeMann]], Veronica "Ronnie" Dashev and [[Time Warner]],{{cite news |first=Stephen |last=Holden |authorlink=Stephen Holden|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/04/20/arts/madonna-makes-a-60-million-deal.html |work=[[The New York Times]]| title=Madonna Makes a $60 Million Deal| accessdate=May 27, 2008|date=April 20, 1992}} and its name was combined from the names of three of the founders; '''Ma'''donna, '''Ve'''ronica and Frede'''rick'''. The company had divisions for recording, music publishing, television, film, merchandising and book publishing. The venture was part of a $60 million recording and business deal between Madonna and [[Time Warner]] . It gave her 20% royalties from the music proceedings, one of the highest rates in the industry, equalled at that time only by Michael Jackson's royalty rate established a year earlier with [[Sony]].{{r|NYT - $60 million}} At the time of its launch. the company was bi-coastal; having offices in both [[New York City]] and [[Los Angeles]]. The record company division of Maverick also consisted of sub-label, Maverick Musica (a Miami, Florida-based satellite label focusing on Latin-American music) and Maverick Music Publishing. The first releases for the company were Madonna's 1992 coffee table publication, ''[[Sex (book)|Sex]]'' and her studio album ''[[Erotica (Madonna album)|Erotica]]'' which were released simultaneously to great controversy.{{cite news |first= Gregory |last= Kirschling| url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,365681,00.html |work=Entertainment Weekly| title=The Naked Launch| accessdate=May 27, 2008|date=October 25, 2002}} ==Commercial success== [[File:Platinum records, Prince, Bruce Springsteen, Juliens Auctions Preview 2011-03-08.jpg|thumb|Platinum record (''middle'') for [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]]'s 2001 greatest hits album, ''[[GHV2]]'', released by Maverick Records.]] Maverick's first commercial success was with the [[Candlebox (album)|self-titled debut album]] by [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]]-based [[grunge]] band [[Candlebox]]. Released in 1993, the album would be RIAA-certified quadruple platinum in the United States. The following year, the label signed Canadian musician [[Alanis Morissette]], whose third album (and Maverick debut) ''[[Jagged Little Pill]]'' was released in 1995, and would be eventually certified 16x platinum in the U.S. (with international sales of $33 million)–making it the best selling album in the label's history, and of the 1990s. DeMann was bought out of the company for a reported $20 million in 1998, after which [[Guy Oseary]] increased his stake in the company and took control as chairman and CEO. Throughout the 1990s to the middle 2000s, Maverick would also release albums by [[Erasure]], [[Michelle Branch]], [[Meshell Ndegeocello]], [[U.N.V.]], [[Dana Dane]], N-Phase, [[Dalvin DeGrate]], [[The Prodigy]], [[Cleopatra (band)|Cleopatra]], [[Tyler Hilton]], [[Muse (band)|Muse]], [[Deftones]], [http://www.smrcamp.com/ Summercamp], [[No Authority]] and [[William Orbit]]. "I'm happy with Maverick as a label," observed The Prodigy's [[Liam Howlett]]. "They respect their bands; even the ones who aren't selling."{{cite magazine|first=Paul|last=Elliott|title=Their year: The Prodigy|magazine=[[Q (magazine)|Q]] #137|date=February 1998|p=95}} ==Litigation and decline== By the early 2000s, Maverick saw its commercial fortunes decline and business operations financially unravel. In March 2004, the label and Madonna filed suit against Warner Music Group (and its former parent company, Time Warner), claiming that mismanagement of resources and poor [[Accountancy|bookkeeping]] had cost the company millions of dollars. Warner filed a countersuit, alleging that Maverick had lost tens of millions of dollars on its own.{{r|labelsuit}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3570563.stm |title=Madonna's label sues record giant |publisher=BBC |date=March 26, 2004|accessdate=June 7, 2008}}{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/music/3570563.stm|title=Entertainment - Madonna's label sues record giant|publisher=BBC}} On June 14, 2004, the dispute was resolved when Maverick shares owned by Madonna and Dashev were purchased — which effectively exiled the two of them from the company, as it then became a wholly owned subsidiary of Warner Music Group. Then Maverick CEO [[Guy Oseary]], meanwhile, retained his position until WMG purchased his label shares in 2006.{{cite news|url=http://www.nme.com/news/madonna/30546|title=Madonna sells record company|work=[[NME]]|accessdate=June 9, 2008|date=August 26, 2007|first=Jason|last=Shawhan}} The same year, the band [[Lillix]], which at the time was signed to the label, claimed that the Maverick label no longer existed and that all the artists were now handled by Warner Bros. directly. In 2007 the record company folded.{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/6289026/u2-and-madonna-manager-guy-oseary-is-trying-to-reinvent-the-music-biz |title=U2 and Madonna Manager Guy Oseary Is Trying to Reinvent the Music Biz |last=Hampp |first=Andrew |date=October 17, 2014 |website=Billboard |access-date=August 1, 2018}} Two of the label's most successful artists, Alanis Morissette and Michelle Branch, left in the late 2000s. Branch left in 2007 after disbanding [[The Wreckers]], while Morissette left in 2009 after the release of ''[[Flavors of Entanglement]]''. Madonna's recording contract remained with [[Warner Bros. Records]] under a separate agreement until 2009.{{Citation needed|date=March 2016}} In 2001, Maverick Picture Company was rebranded as simply Maverick Films and was solely managed by Madonna and [[Guy Oseary]], CEO of another Maverick division, Maverick Records. In 2004, Madonna and Dashev were bought out of Maverick after a lawsuit with Warner Music Group and they no longer have an interest in the company.{{citation needed|date=November 2018}} In August 2008, company head Mark Morgan and Oseary split with Oseary retaining the rights to the Maverick name while Morgan retain ownership of the company's projects and changing the name to [[Imprint Entertainment]]. In 2010, Maverick Records brought teenage file-sharer, Whitney Harper, to court and won the case. Harper was ordered to pay $750 per song for the three dozen uploaded on the Internet.{{cite web|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/business/court-rejects-teens-appeal-in-internet-music-case/|title=Court rejects teen's appeal in Internet music case|date=November 29, 2010|work=The Seattle Times}} The case is known as ''Harper v. Maverick Recording Co.''.{{cite web|url=http://www.loeb.com/articles-ipentertainmentcaselawupdates-20101208-harpervmaverickrecordingco|title=Harper v. Maverick Recording Co.|publisher=Loeb}} In 2011, Maverick Records co-released [[Greyson Chance]]'s debut album ''[[Hold On 'til the Night]]'', but other than that the label has remained in dormancy. ==Selected recording artists== {{Div col}} *[[Aaron Bruno]] (2002) *[[Alanis Morissette]] *[[Bad Brains]] (1994, 1995) *[[Baxter (electronica band)|Baxter]] (1998) *[[Candlebox]] *[[Cleopatra (girl group)|Cleopatra]] *[[Dana Dane]] (1994, 1995) * Dalvin DeGrate *[[David Bowie]] (2009) *[[Deftones]] *[[Goldfinger (band)|Goldfinger]] (2005) *[[Jack's Mannequin]] (2005, 2010, 2015) *[[Lenny Kravitz]] (1999) *[[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] *[[Marilyn Manson]] (1998, 1999, 2001, 2002, 2003) *[[Meshell Ndegeocello]] *[[Mest]] *[[Michelle Branch]] (2001, 2002, 2003) *[[Muse (band)|Muse]] (1999, 2000, 2004) *[[Neurotic Outsiders]] (1996, 1997) *[[Nick Perito]] *[[Paul Oakenfold]] (2002, 2006) *[[Solar Twins (band)|Solar Twins]] (1999, 2000) *[[Tantric (band)|Tantric]] (2000, 2001, 2003, 2004) *[[The Prodigy]] *[[The Wreckers]] (2006, 2007) *[[Tyler Hilton]] (2001, 2004, 2005) *[[William Orbit]] (1999, 2000) {{div col end}} ==Other divisions== *Maverick Musica – Latin division of Maverick Records{{Cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1999/nov/28/entertainment/ca-38187|title=Maverick Records Goes for Baroque With Orbit|last=HOCHMAN|first=STEVE|date=November 28, 1999|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=June 19, 2018|issn=0458-3035}} *Maverick Books – book publishing *Maverick Films - production company, now [[Imprint Entertainment]] *MadGuy Television – television production, now Imprint Television *MadGuy Films – film and television production *Maverick Music – publishing division ==See also== * [[2010 term United States Supreme Court opinions of Samuel Alito]] * [[BMG Music v. Gonzalez]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://maverick.com Official Website] {{Madonna}} {{Warner Music Group}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Maverick (Entertainment Company)}} [[Category:Entertainment companies of the United States]] [[Category:Film production companies of the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in California]] [[Category:Defunct record labels of the United States]] [[Category:Record labels based in California]] [[Category:Pop record labels]] [[Category:Rock record labels]] [[Category:Soundtrack record labels]] [[Category:Defunct companies based in the Greater Los Angeles Area]] [[Category:Record labels established in 1992]] [[Category:Record labels disestablished in 2007]] [[Category:Warner Music labels]] [[Category:Labels distributed by Warner Music Group]] [[Category:Madonna (entertainer)]] [[Category:Warner Bros. {{Refimprove|date=February 2016}} The '''Mexican sex comedies film genre,''' generally known as '''Ficheras film''' or '''Sexicomedias''' is a [[Film genre|genre]] of [[sexploitation]] and [[Mexploitation]]{{CN|date=February 2016}} films of the [[Mexican cinema]] that flourished in the 1970s and 1980s. It is recognized as a collection of usually low quality films with [[Low-budget film|low budgets]]. Although the films had sexual tones and used [[double entendre]], they were not particularly explicit. The genre is possibly based on the [[Commedia sexy all'italiana|Italian erotic comedies]].<ref>[http://cinemexicano.mty.itesm.mx/ficheras.html 1976-1982: Los años de las "Ficheras"]</ref> The popular term for it came from the film ''Las ficheras,'' produced and released in 1975, which described the experiences of many women who entertained men at nightclubs.
The settings and plots of these films tended to be simple. Though they enjoyed box-office success and were popular, they are now generally regarded as poor examples of Mexican cinema {{by whom?|date=December 2017}}; moreover, they frequently received classification as being unsuitable for minors.
Some of the films of this Mexican genre included ''El rey de las ficheras,'' ''La pulquería,'' ''Muñecas de medianoche,'' ''[[Bellas de noche]],'' and ''Entre ficheras anda el diablo.''
The best-known Mexican actors and actresses who were known to have participated in ficheras films were: * [[Sasha Montenegro]] * Angélica Chaín * [[Andrés García]] * [[Mauricio Garcés]] * Lina Santos * [[Lyn May]] * [[Marcia Bell]] * Leticia Perdigón * Carmen Salinas * Alfonso Zayas * Jorge Rivero * Alberto Rojas "El caballo" * Rafael Inclán * Roberto Ibañez * Leopoldo García Peláez Benítez "Polo Polo" * Antonio Raxel * Raúl Padilla "El Choforo" * Miguel M. Delgado * Luis de Alba * René Ruíz "Tun Tun" * Pedro Weber "Chatanooga" * César Bono * Eduardo de la Peña "Lalo el Mimo" * [[Rossy Mendoza]]
== See also == * [[Commedia sexy all'italiana]] * [[Sex comedy]] * [[Cinema of Mexico]]

The '''Montreal International Games Summit''' (MIGS), also known as le Sommet International du jeu de Montréal (SIJM), is a conference on video games. The first edition was held in 2004 and usually takes place in November at le Palais des Congrès de Montréal. The summit was founded in order to meet the needs of the rough 9000 video game workers in Quebec. The mission of the summit is to expand the exposure of the video game community and industry in Quebec as well as develop the expertise of the Quebec video game industry. MIGS is currently the leading professional gaming summit of the East Coast,<ref>http://mtldgtl.com/en/migs/</ref> and is arguably the largest game development event in Canada.<ref>http://ca.ign.com/articles/2008/11/12/montreal-international-game-summit-to-open-to-the-public-for-the-first-time</ref> The overall aims of MIGS are to promote, train, network, and hire potential players in the gaming industry. Professionals attending the summit partake in lectures and presentations largely oriented around how to better specific aspects of the industry, such as art and VFX, business, and design.<ref>http://mtldgtl.com/en/migs/about/</ref> Currently, MIGS has partnered with many of the leading electronic and game development companies in Canada, including Ubisoft and Warner Bros. Games. The Montreal International Gaming Summit is networked similarly to the Electronic Entertainment Expo, using the same application in order to facilitate interaction between industry players and their associates. It was only in 2008, during the fifth summit, did MIGS become an event that was open to the public.<ref>http://ca.ign.com/articles/2008/11/12/montreal-international-game-summit-to-open-to-the-public-for-the-first-time</ref> 2013 marked the tenth annual Montreal International Gaming Summit.<ref>http://www.mrifce.gouv.qc.ca/portail/_scripts/Actualites/ViewNew.asp?strIdSite=la&NewID=13099&lang=en{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Events==
===Business Lounge=== The Business Lounge is designed in order to establish collaboration and finalize ideas by key decision makers in the industry. It is located away from the summit itself as only professional members of the industry may attend.<ref>http://mtldgtl.com/en/business-lounge-2/</ref> Most corporate figures that attend the summit also make appearances at the business lounge, as it is a hub for most corporate decisions at the summit. Attendees at the lounge may also attend exclusive cocktail events, where they may interact with other corporate figures and keynotes speakers at the summit.
====Online Meeting Application==== The Online Meeting Application is an application that is utilized at the Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3). This application is used to book meetings with summit attendees.<ref>http://mtldgtl.com/en/business-lounge-2/</ref> The application was developed by Game Connection, and allows attendees to contact industry figures directly, manage scheduling, and promote themselves as players in the industry.<ref>https://www.e3expo.com/attendee/2165/e3-meeting-application-powered-by-game-connection/</ref>
===Expo Zone=== The Expo Zone is the central attraction at MIGS. It is where all presentations and showcases for new products are displayed. Video game artists also feature their work in the Expo Zone. Most readily available attractions at MIGS are available in the Expo Zone. It is also possible for attendees to book places in order to promote themselves and their products.<ref>http://mtldgtl.com/en/exhibition-zone/</ref> The Expo Zone is the most readily available attraction for general interest attendees who are not part of the professional industry. Since MIGS opened to the public in 2008, the Expo Zone has become the primary attraction for the general public.
===2012=== MIGS 2012 was held on November 13 and November 14 at the Hilton Montreal Bonaventure. The theme for the year's event was "The Future. Unknown", and was focused on the upcoming trends in the video game industry as well as new technologies and breakthroughs that could impact the future of video game development. The opening keynote was presented by [[Tim Sweeney (game developer)|Tim Sweeney]], founder of [[Epic Games]], on some of the current technologies used in games. The second day's opening keynote was presented by [[Peter Molyneux]], currently the CEO and founder of [[22Cans]] with a talk about game design. Finally the event was closed out by a "Brain Dump" session with various industry professionals.
==Partners== The following is a list of the current partners and sponsors of the MIGS<ref>http://mtldgtl.com/en/partners/</ref> * China Cultural Industry Association (Guest Country) * BlackBerry (Silver Partner) * Ludia (Bronze Partner) * Investissement Quebec (VIP Cocktail Partner) * Fasken Martineau (Business Lounge Partner) * espresso-jobs.com (Career Fair Partner) * Warner Bros. Games Montreal (Photobooth Partner) * 3vis (Battle of the Studios Partner) * Autodesk (Battle of the Studios Partner) * Wacom (Battle of the Studios Partner) * Eidos Montreal (Coffee Breaks Partner) * Square Enix (Coffee Breaks Partner) * Arches Partner (Ubisoft)
==External links== * [http://www.sijm.ca Official site]
{{reflist}} * http://mtldgtl.com/en/migs/ * http://mtldgtl.com/en/business-lounge-2/ * https://www.e3expo.com/attendee/2165/e3-meeting-application-powered-by-game-connection/ * http://mtldgtl.com/en/migs/about/ * http://mtldgtl.com/en/exhibition-zone/ * http://mtldgtl.com/en/partners/ * http://www.mrifce.gouv.qc.ca/portail/_scripts/Actualites/ViewNew.asp?strIdSite=la&NewID=13099&lang=en{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * http://ca.ign.com/articles/2008/11/12/montreal-international-game-summit-to-open-to-the-public-for-the-first-time

{{Infobox film |name=Mother's Happiness |image=mothershappiness.jpg |caption=A screenshot |film_name={{Infobox name module|traditional={{linktext|兒|孫|福}}|simplified={{linktext|儿|孙|福}}|pinyin=Ér Sūn Fú|translation=Fortunes of Descendants}} |director=[[Shi Dongshan]] |writer=[[Zhu Shouju]] |cinematography={{Unbulleted list|S.M. Chow|S.S. Yue}} |language=Silent film, with Chinese and English intertitles |country=[[Republic of China (1912–1949)|Republic of China]] |starring={{Unbulleted list|[[Zhou Wenzhu]]|[[Wang Cilong]]|[[Wang Naidong]]|[[Fu Jianqin]]}} |released=1926 |runtime=~48 minutes (extant version, incomplete) |studio={{Unbulleted list|Yueming Film Company|Great China Lilium Pictures}} }} '''''Mother's Happiness''''' is a 1926 Chinese drama film directed by [[Shi Dongshan]] and written by [[Zhu Shouju]], starring [[Zhou Wenzhu]] as a devoted rural mother who reared 4 children by herself after her husband died from an accident. It is one of the earliest extant Chinese films, but a portion is still missing. Like most Chinese films from this period, it is a black-and-white [[silent film]] with both Chinese and English [[intertitle]]s.
The English title is ironic, because the mother in the story hardly enjoyed any happiness in her life.<ref>{{cite book|title=China on Screen: Cinema and Nation|last=Berry|first=Chris|last2=Farquhar|first2=Mary|isbn=0-231-13706-0|year=2006|publisher=[[Columbia University Press]]|page=243}}</ref>
==Plot== After the birth of her children, a rural mother becomes so devoted to them that she completely neglects her ill-tempered husband. When her baby becomes ill, she even tries to commit suicide, fortunately the baby recovers. Her husband, who works for a wealthy man, is blamed and fired after the man's son squanders twenty thousand dollars. He sulkily returns home, beats up his naughty son, and accidentally drinks himself to death with the wrong type of alcohol. After his death, the mother works as a seamstress and manages to send all her children to a private school. At school, the children are bullied by a kid from a wealthy family, but the teacher never punishes him.
(Part missing)
Decades later, the children are all married. The eldest son has a crude wife who disrespects the mother. The second daughter-in-law is respectful but unhealthy. The eldest daughter lives in a wealthy household with servants, but she is completely unfilial. Even when she returns home for brief visits (just to impress the neighbors, as she says), she treats the entire family with contempt. Another daughter, who is widowed, also lives away from home.
Both sons set off for jobs in the city, and the mother is left behind with the second daughter-in-law. The eldest son wants to send money home but is stopped by his stern wife. He gives the money to his brother to send home, but the second son squanders all the money on a lascivious woman. With no income to pay the rent, the mother and the second daughter-in-law have to seek shelter with her eldest daughter. The daughter accepts them, but calls them servants in front of her friends. Her ill-tempered husband is disgusted by the mother's impoverished appearance and lashes out at her.
The second son loses his job as a result of persistent tardiness and poor performance. He tries to borrow money from his mistress but discovers that she has a new lover who happens to be his best friend. Meanwhile, the mother is driven away from her daughter's house and comes to the city to visit the brothers. Eventually she falls terminally ill, and all her children reunite before her deathbed. The mother tells the second son to kneel in front of his wife, and is pleased that he finally repents.
==Cast== {{Div col|colwidth=30em}} *Zhou Wenzhu as Mother *Xie Yunqing (Y.C. Zai) as Father *Wang Cilong as Eldest son *Yang Jingwo as Eldest daughter-in-law *Wang Naidong (Lyton Wong) as Second son *Lin Ying as Second daughter-in-law *Fu Jianqin as Eldest daughter *Wang Zhengxin as Eldest son-in-law *Wang Xiuying as Second daughter *Tang Tianxiu (T.S. Tong) as Lascivious woman {{div col end}}
==Remakes== There have been two remakes, the 1937 film ''Song for a Mother'' (慈母曲) by [[Zhu Shilin]], and the 1953 Hong Kong film ''A Mother Remembers'' (慈母淚) by Chun Kim.<ref>{{cite book|title=Melodrama Unbound: Across History, Media, and National Cultures|chapter=Transnational Melodrama, ''Wenyi'', and the Orphan Imagination|isbn=978-0-231-18066-5|editor-last=Gledhill|editor-first=Christine|editor2-last=Williams|editor2-first=Linda|publisher=[[Columbia University Press]]|editor2-link=Linda Williams (film scholar)|last=Zhang|first=Zhen|year=2018}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2017}} {{Infobox magazine | image_file = | image_size = | image_caption = | editor = | editor_title = | frequency = | circulation = | category = Trade magazine | company = | publisher = Die Wirtschaft | founded =1954 | firstdate = April 1956 | finaldate = 1991 | country = [[German Democratic Republic]] | based = [[East Berlin]] | language = [[German language|German]] | website = | issn = |oclc = }} '''''Neue Werbung''''' (meaning ''New Advertising'' in English) was a [[East German]] trade magazine specializing on [[advertising]]. Originally subtitled Fachzeitschrift für Werbung, Gebrauchsgrafik und Dekoration, the magazine was published between 1954 and 1991.<ref name="ddrw">{{cite web|title=Literaturverzeichnis|url=http://www.ddr-werbefiguren.de/werbefiguren/literatur.html|work=DDR-Werbung|accessdate=29 January 2017|language=German}}</ref> The headquarters was in [[East Berlin]].
==History and profile== ''Neue Werbung'' was established in 1954.<ref name="cb">{{cite web|title="Mass and Class" – Advertising and Commercial Art in East Germany|url=http://www.centralberlin.de/blog/mass-and-class-advertising-and-commercial-art-in-east-germany/|work=Central Berlin|accessdate=29 January 2017|date=24 March 2016}}</ref> The first issue was published in April 1954.<ref name="pen">{{cite book|author1=Penny Sparke|author2=Fiona Fisher|title=The Routledge Companion to Design Studies|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=6RBqDAAAQBAJ&pg=PT339|accessdate=29 January 2017|date=17 June 2016|publisher=Taylor & Francis|isbn=978-1-317-20328-5|page=339}}</ref> The magazine was published by Die Wirtschaft on a monthly basis in East Berlin.<ref name="ddrw"/><ref name="cb"/> It was the official magazine of East Germany targeting advertising professionals.<ref>{{cite book|author=Joe Perry|title=Christmas in Germany: A Cultural History|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=wlSmtlw6-bwC&pg=PA276|accessdate=29 January 2017|date=27 September 2010|publisher=Univ of North Carolina Press|isbn=978-0-8078-9941-0|page=276}}</ref> Each cover of the magazine was developed by East German [[designers]].<ref name="pen"/> It featured thematic articles for the first ten years such as [[trademarks]], [[industrial design]], currency designs, and catalogue [[shopping]].<ref name="pen"/> The magazine covered retailing activities in the country.<ref>{{cite book|author1=Paulina Bren|author2=Mary Neuburger|title=Communism Unwrapped: Consumption in Cold War Eastern Europe|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=nn4wXGt9S18C&pg=PA138|accessdate=29 January 2017|date=20 September 2012|publisher=OUP USA|isbn=978-0-19-982767-1|page=138}}</ref>
''Neue Werbung'' had nearly a circulation of 17,000 copies.<ref name="cb"/> In 1959 its subtitle was changed to Fachzeitschrift für Theorie und Praxis der Sozialistischen Wirtschaftswerbung (Professional Journal for the Theory and Practice of Socialist Commercial Advertising).<ref name=pen/> The magazine ceased publication in 1991.<ref name="ddrw"/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Neue Werbung}} [[Category:1954 establishments in East Germany]] [[Category:1991 disestablishments in Germany]] [[Category:Defunct magazines of Germany]] [[Category:Design magazines]] [[Category:Eastern Bloc media]] [[Category:East German media]] [[Category:German business magazines]] [[Category:German-language magazines]] [[Category:German monthly magazines]] [[Category:Magazines about advertising]] [[Category:Magazines established in 1954]] [[Category:Magazines disestablished in 1991]] [[Category:Magazines published in Berlin]] [[Category:Socialist magazines]] [[Category:Professional and trade magazines]]

{{Infobox amusement park | name = Parko Paliatso LUNA PARK | image = Parkopaliatso.png | caption = | location = [[Ayia Napa]] | location3 = [[Republic of Cyprus]] | coordinates = | homepage = http://parkopaliatsocy.com/ | owner = Vali Amusement | area = {{convert|7.41|acre}} | rides = 40 rides, slides and games | slogan = Life is a beautiful ride! | special features = Highest ejection seat ride in Europe (The Sling-Shot) }} '''Parko Paliatso LUNA PARK''' is an amusement park in the strip of [[Ayia Napa]]. It is the biggest funfair in the [[Cyprus|Republic of Cyprus]] and features the highest ejection seat ride in [[Europe]] (the 90m tall Sling-Shot)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.loveayianapa.com/sling-shot-ayia-napa.html|title=SLING SHOT AYIA NAPA|last=|first=|date=|website=loveayianapa|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
It was established in 1999 by Vali Amusements Ltd<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ergodotisi.com/en/Company/Vali%20Amusements%20Ltd%20(Parko%20Paliatso)|title=Vali Amusements Ltd (Parko Paliatso)|last=|first=|date=|website=ergodotisi.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>. It is open every day of the week and offers 40 rides, slides and games. It covers an area of 30,000 m<sup>2</sup> (7.4 acres)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tourist-butler.com/AyiaNapa-Protaras/parko-paliatso/|title=Parko Paliatso info|last=|first=|date=|website=tourist butler|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
== Attractions == The park offers 4 different kinds of rides<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://parkopaliatsocy.com/all-rides/|title=the park's rides|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>:
4 "Extreme rides"
2 "Family extreme rides"
9 "Family rides"
10 "Kiddie rides".
It also offers a number of [[Amusement arcade|amusement arcade games]] and [[Carnival Games|carnival games]] (e.g. shooting gallery, lucky games etc).
The park has a 1000 square meter restaurant and a free playground area, 6 kiosks (selling corn, hot-dogs, ice-cream, crepes, donuts etc), and 2 bars (selling Cocktails, Long Drinks, Beers, Soft Drinks, Slush Ice etc)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://whatsoncy.com/2018/06/28/parko-paliatso-luna-park-ayia-napa/|title=Parko Paliatso Luna Park, Ayia Napa, The official guide to Cyprus|last=|first=|date=|website=What'sOn! Cyprus Guide|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
Due to its central location in Ayia Napa, a parking area is available that can host up to 300 cars at a time.
New attractions are being constantly added (with the most recent one being the "Looping Star")<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://rcdb.com/16111.htm|title=Looping Star Ayia Napa|last=|first=|date=|website=rcdb|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>; currently 1 new is approved.<gallery> File:Thunder Loop Slagharen.jpg|Looping star roller coaster </gallery><gallery> File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (339).jpg|The park's entrance sign. File:Ayia Napa látképe az óriáskerékről - View of Ayia Napa from the giant wheel - panoramio (4).jpg|Inside the Ferris wheel File:Ayia Napa látképe az óriáskerékről - View of Ayia Napa from the giant wheel - panoramio (3).jpg|View from "The Giant Wheel" File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (359).jpg|View from the Ferris wheel. File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (191).jpg|The minor of the 2 roller coasters. File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (341).jpg|The 30-meter tall Booster File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (365).jpg|The Sling Shot, the highest ejection seat ride in Europe. File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (209).jpg|The 45-meter tall Ferris wheel. File:Ayia Napa, Cyprus - panoramio (353).jpg|A "Family extreme" ride </gallery>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Amusement park attractions]]

'''Prostitution in Peru''' is legal and [[Regulated prostitution|regulated]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1987-12-26/news/ss-7391_1_aids-scare|title=Business Is Off at Peru Brothels : AIDS Scare Prompts Officials to Promote Use of Condoms|first=TIM|last=JOHNSON|date=26 December 1987|publisher=|accessdate=9 January 2017|via=LA Times}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=A-9wBAAAQBAJ&pg=PA27&dq=Prostitution%20in%20Peru#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=A History of Family Planning in Twentieth-century Peru|first=Raúl Necochea|last=López|date=1 January 2014|publisher=UNC Press Books|accessdate=9 January 2017|via=Google Books|isbn=9781469618081}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=HJp6BAAAQBAJ&pg=PA27&lpg=PA27&dq=Prostitution%20in%20Peru#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=A History of Family Planning in Twentieth-Century Peru|first=Raúl Necochea|last=López|date=15 October 2014|publisher=UNC Press Books|accessdate=9 January 2017|via=Google Books|isbn=9781469618098}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=HzNwBAAAQBAJ&pg=PA318&dq=Prostitution%20in%20Peru#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=The Right to Health: A Multi-Country Study of Law, Policy and Practice|first1=Brigit|last1=Toebes|first2=Rhonda|last2=Ferguson|first3=Milan M.|last3=Markovic|first4=Obiajulu|last4=Nnamuchi|date=5 September 2014|publisher=Springer|accessdate=9 January 2017|via=Google Books|isbn=9789462650145}}</ref> [[UNAIDS]] estimate there to be 67,000 prostitutes in the country.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sex workers: Population size estimate - Number, 2016 |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/dv/PivotData_2018_7_22_636678151733621264.htm |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref>
==Adult prostitution== Prostitution between adults is legal for women and men over 18 years of age if they register with municipal authorities and carry a health certificate. <ref name="auto">{{cite web |url= https://www.state.gov/g/drl/rls/hrrpt/2008/wha/119170.htm |title= 2008 Human Rights Report: Peru|accessdate=2007-11-29 |website= US Department of State |publisher= |date= }}</ref> [[Brothels]] must be licensed. The vast majority of prostitutes work in the [[informal sector]], where they lack health protection.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=6WYZ0wNpZfIC&pg=PA179&dq=Prostitution%20in%20Peru#v=onepage&q=Prostitution%20in%20Peru&f=false|title=Men who Sell Sex: International Perspectives on Male Prostitution and HIV/AIDS|first=Peter|last=Aggleton|date=1 January 1999|publisher=Temple University Press|accessdate=9 January 2017|via=Google Books|isbn=9781566396691}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=-5WyPfynlwMC&pg=PA518&dq=Prostitution%20in%20Peru#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=Encyclopedia of Prostitution and Sex Work|first=Melissa Hope|last=Ditmore|date=1 January 2006|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|accessdate=9 January 2017|via=Google Books|isbn=9780313329708}}</ref><ref name="auto"/> Individual police officers tolerate the operation of unlicensed brothels. <ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/publisher,USDOS,,PER,484f9a3528,0.html |title= Trafficking in Persons Report 2008 - Peru|accessdate=2009-11-16 |website= The UN Refugee Agency |publisher= |date= }}</ref>
==Child prostitution== [[Child prostitution]] is illegal. Penalties for pimps and clients of underage prostitutes range from four to eight years in prison. <ref name="auto"/> Child prostitution is common in the country, and especially in Peru’s isolated Amazonian mining communities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/alfonso-daniels/child-prostitution-boomin_b_1086278.html|title=Child Prostitution Booming in Peruvian Amazon|first=Alfonso Daniels Emergency Media Manager for Save the Children|last=International|date=14 November 2011|publisher=|accessdate=9 January 2017}}</ref> In the Amazonian department of [[Madre de Dios Region|Madre de Dios]] the illegal exploitation of [[gold]] has dramatically increased the recruitment and coercion of adolescents into prostitution through false employment offers. <ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.peruviantimes.com/la-republica-expose-on-child-prostitution-in-peruvian-amazon-mining-towns/10555 |title= La Republica: Exposé on child prostitution in Peruvian Amazon mining towns|accessdate=2009-11-16 |website= Peruvian Times |publisher= |date= }}</ref>
While [[poverty]] and [[Economic inequality|inequality]] are important causes of child prostitution, part of the problem is also a social attitude that views sex--including paid sex--between adult men and adolescent girls as normal. Luis Gonzalez-Polar Zuzunada, president of La Restinga (an [[Iquitos]]-based nonprofit organization that works with at-risk children) said about teenage prostitution:"It's not seen as a crime. People think that's the way it is. Here, anyone is a potential client."<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.catholicnews.com/data/stories/cns/0602361.htm |title= In Peruvian jungle city, church works to help child prostitutes|accessdate=2009-11-16 |website= Catholic News Service |publisher= |date= }}</ref>
The Peruvian government recognizes [[child sex tourism]] to be a problem, particularly in [[Iquitos]], [[Madre de Dios Region|Madre de Dios]], and [[Cuzco]]. <ref name="auto1">{{cite web |url= https://www.state.gov/documents/organization/123363.pdf |title= Human Trafficking|accessdate=2009-11-16 |website= US Department of State |publisher= |date= }}</ref>
==Sex trafficking== {{see also|Human trafficking in Peru}} Peru is a source, transit point, and destination for [[human trafficking|trafficked]] persons. The majority of human trafficking occurs within the country.
Many trafficking victims are women and girls from impoverished rural regions of the Amazon, recruited and coerced into prostitution in urban nightclubs, bars, and brothels, often through false employment offers or promises of education.<ref name="auto"/>
Domestic trafficking occurs particularly in districts located in the [[Andes]] or the [[Amazon jungle]], to bring underage girls into cities or mining areas to work as prostitutes. Victims are recruited by friends or acquaintances and through newspaper and [[Internet]] advertisements or street posters offering employment; some victims are recruited by local employment agencies that offer poor young women from rural areas relatively well-paid "restaurant work" in [[Lima]], [[Cusco]], major coastal cities, and abroad. <ref name="auto"/>
The principal victims and groups at high risk for trafficking are children and young women from rural or poor urban areas, persons living in poverty, persons with disabilities, victims of domestic abuse, illiterate persons, and persons lacking birth certificates or other identification documents.
Peru also is a destination country for some [[Ecuadorian]] and [[Bolivia|Bolivian]] women trafficked for commercial sexual exploitation.<ref name="auto1"/>
The [[United States Department of State]] [[Office to Monitor and Combat Trafficking in Persons]] ranks Peru as a '[[Trafficking in Persons Report#Ranking System|Tier 2]]' country.<ref name="state18">{{cite web |title=Peru2018 Trafficking in Persons Report |url=https://www.state.gov/j/tip/rls/tiprpt/countries/2018/282730.htm |website=U.S. Department of State |accessdate=30 July 2018}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://archive.peruthisweek.com/news/3431 Lima, Peru: Want to get rid of prostitution? Add more light]

{{About|an Australian demographic phenomenon||Seachange (disambiguation){{!}}Sea change}}
[[File:Barwon Heads boatshed Stevage.jpg|250px|right|thumb|The boatshed in Barwon Heads used as a set in ''SeaChange'' was redeveloped into a restaurant.]]
In [[Australia]]n culture, a '''seachange''' (or '''sea change''') is a form of [[human migration]] that involves individuals abandoning [[Urbanism|city living]] in favour of a perceived 'easier life' in rural coastal communities. The term was popularised by the popular Australian [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC TV]] television series ''[[SeaChange]]'', which triggered the phenomenon of many city-dwellers mimicking the drama's protagonist's escape from urban life.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.smh.com.au/travel/salty-waters-and-village-vibe-20090212-862p.html | work=The Sydney Morning Herald | title=Salty waters and village vibe | date=2009-02-14}}</ref> It ultimately comes from [[William Shakespeare|Shakespeare's]] ''[[The Tempest]]''<ref>{{cite web|title=Sea change|url=http://www.worldwidewords.org/qa/qa-sea1.htm|work=World Wide Words|accessdate=15 April 2012}}</ref>. The result of this phenomenon (known as the 'sea change effect') is a rapid boom in [[tourism]] and [[real estate]] development in coastal [[Australia]], particularly in [[New South Wales]].
A similar term, '''treechange''', describes the movement of urbanites to the [[countryside]].
==''SeaChange''== {{main|SeaChange}} In the television series ''SeaChange'', the main character Laura Gibson fulfils her escapist desire by leaving the city for a small seaside town after her career and family life in [[Melbourne]] falls apart. The series, which ran from 1998 to 2000, became one of the most popular programmes in Australia and focused on life outside the big city. The primary filming location for the series at [[Barwon Heads, Victoria|Barwon Heads]] on the [[Bellarine Peninsula]] was the first to experience the seachange effect, with fans of the series both visiting and moving to the community. {{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} This experience was replicated in coastal towns across Australia. {{Citation needed|date=February 2007}}
==Who is shifting== People shifting to the coast have been characterised as: *Free agent migrators **Include retirees **Majority are of working age, drawn to service the needs of retirees and tourists **Sub categories include pre-retirees, alternative lifestylers and internet business operators *Forced relocating migrants **Principally people reliant on income support including unemployed, single parents and the disabled.<ref name = Dryden>{{cite web|url = http://www.bitre.gov.au/publications/90/Files/p_dryden.pdf| format = pdf (19 pages)| title = Aspects of the ‘Sea Change’ pheonmenon in the Surf Coast Region of Victoria|last = Dryden|first = Peter| publisher = Australian Government: Bureau of Infrastructure, Transport and Regional Economics |accessdate = 2008-06-25}}</ref>
==Effect== The rate of growth in rural coastal areas is 60% higher than the national average.<ref name = SCAbt>{{cite web|url = http://www.seachangetaskforce.org.au/About.html |title = About the Seachange Taskforce|publisher = National Sea Change Taskforce | year = 2008| accessdate = 2008-06-25}}</ref> Almost six million people already reside in coastal areas outside the mainland capitals,<ref name = SCAbt/> and a further one million are expected by 2020. In addition to people seeking a better lifestyle, the seachange phenomenon is driven by retiring [[baby boomer]]s and people forced out of capital cities by high house prices.<ref>[http://www.seachangetaskforce.org.au/Publications/The%20Challenge.pdf The Challenge of Seachange Growth]</ref> It typically involves either the purchase of a secondary (or holiday) home in, or a complete shift to, coastal areas.
The seachange effect is having both positive and adverse effects on local communities. While it has led to increased prosperity in regional areas, the phenomenon has also caused an increased burden on local governments.
In response to the influx of tourists and new residents to their jurisdictions, coastal councils from around Australia formed the '''National Sea Change Taskforce''' in 2004 to seek ways to ensure sustainable development in their communities. As at 2008 there are 68 member councils from around Australia collectively representing more than four million residents.<ref name = SCHome>{{cite web|url = http://www.seachangetaskforce.org.au/Home.html |title = National Sea Change Taskforce |publisher = National Sea Change Taskforce | year = 2008| accessdate = 2008-06-25}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Elbow roomers]], people who leave a city for the countryside to seek more land and greater freedom from governmental and neighborhood interference
==References== <references />
==Further reading== *[https://books.google.com/books?id=4dFgAQAAQBAJ&pg=PT109&dq=%22seachange%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=PmAnU6XaCIn6oAS5t4HIAw&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAjgK#v=onepage&q=%22seachange%22&f=false ''Seeking Authenticity in Place, Culture, and the Self: The Great Urban Escape''] *[https://books.google.com/books?id=D20NAhVexHMC&pg=PA297&dq=%22seachange%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=8F8nU4XaD4KGogSApoLQBQ&ved=0CDoQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22seachange%22&f=false ''Boomtown 2050: Scenarios for a Rapidly Growing City''].
==External links== *[http://www.seachangetaskforce.org.au/ National Sea Change Taskforce] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20061009012118/http://www.unsw.edu.au/news/pad/media/2001/aug/seachange.html The Effect of Living the 'Sea Change' Dream]

{{Infobox company | name = Tadjikflim | logo = | type = [[Corporation]]| foundation = 1930| location = [[Dushanbe]], [[Tadjikistan]]| key_people = | num_employees = | industry = [[Motion picture]]s
[[Animated film]]s| products = [[Motion picture]]s
[[Television program]]s| revenue = | homepage = | }} '''Tajikfilm''' ({{lang-tg|Тоҷикфилм}}, {{lang-ru|Таджикфильм}}) is a Tajik (former [[Soviet Union|Soviet]]) film studio. Tajikfilm was founded in 1930 as a [[newsreel]] studio; the studio released its first feature film in 1932 and its first talky in 1935. In 1941 Tajikfilm merged with [[Soyuzdetfilm]], only to reemerge in 1943. The studio produced films in both Russian and Tajik. The studio is based in [[Dushanbe]], [[Tajikistan]]. ==Films== *''Smert' rostovschika'' (''Смерть ростовщика'') – 1966. *''Skazanie o Rustame'' (''Сказание о Рустаме'') – 1972. *''Rustam i Suhrab'' (''Рустам и Сухрaб'') – 1972. *''Zvezda v nochi'' (''Звезда в ночи'') – 1972. *''Skazanie o Siyavysche'' (''Сказание о Сиявуше'') – 1976. *''[[The Bodyguard (1979 film)|The Bodyguard]]'' – 1979. *''V talom snege zvon ruchya'' (''В талом снеге звон ручья'') – 1983. *''Semeinye tainy'' (''Семейные тайны'') – 1985. *''Govoryaschii rodnik'' (''Говорящий родник'') – 1986. *''[[The Last Night of Scheherazade]]'' — 1987 ==External links== *{{imdb company|id=0114187|company=Tajikfilm (Soviet studio)}} * {{bcdb |Other_Studios/T/T-_Miscellany/Tadjikfilm/|Tadjikfilm }} * [http://www.movies-dictionary.org/International Movies Dictionary] {{Soviet Film Studios}} [[Category:Film production companies of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Film studios]] [[Category:Cinema of Tajikistan]] [[Category:1930 establishments in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Media companies established in 1930]] {{film-studio-stub}}

revision.text:
[[File:Bhadrakali Theeyattu.jpg|thumb|A Theeyattu performer]] '''Theeyaattam''' also known as '''Theeyaattu''' (Tīyāttu) is a traditional dance form. There were two types of Theeyaattam - '''Bhadrakali Theeyaattu''' and '''Ayyappan Theeyaattu'''. Bhadrakali Theeyattu is performed by '''[[Theeyaattunnis]]''' (''a Brahmin community in Kerala'') whereas Ayyappan Theeyaattu is performed by '''Tīyyādi Nambiars''' (''Ambalavasi'').
==Bhadrakali Theeyattu== {{Hinduism}} Bhadrakali Tiyyattu is a ritualistic dance usually performed in [[Bhadrakali]] temples, mostly in the [[Pathanamthitta]], [[Alappuzha]], [[Kottayam]] and [[Ernakulam]] districts of south-central Kerala. [[Pallippurathu Kavu]] at Kottayam (family temple of Kottarathil Sankunni) Thrikkariyoor Mahadeva Temple,Panachimangalath Bhadrakali temple(family temple of Panachimangalath Illam) near Kothamangalam,Vanarkavu at Madakkathanam, near Thodupuzha,Puthukulangara Devi Kshetram near Thiruvalla are some of the places where tiyyattu is performed during annual festivals. It is also performed as an offering at temples and houses.
The performance has many parts of which - preparation of the ritual art known as kalam (Kalamezhuthu), singing songs in praise of Bhadrakali and the performance of the dance are a few. Kalamezhuthu is done during the day using natural coloured powders on the floor. An elaborate picture of Bhadrakali is normally made. The singing of the songs take place after the Kalamezhuthu is finished in front of it and may last up to three hours. For the dance a male member dresses up as [[Bhadrakali]], a creation of Shiva. In the performance she is just back from killing Darika and is telling the events to Shiva who is symbolised by the lighted lamp. As she was affected by small pox and has pockmarks on her face she has her back to the lamp almost throughout the performance.
Shree Bhadra Kalasamajam, Kottayam made some efforts to revive and reform the art.As it is being as a ritualistic art form and has strict traditional rituals which are strictly followed even now,Theeyattu cannot be modified at one's will.
==Ayyappan Thiyyaattu==
Ayyappan Thiyyattu is a temple art performed by the Thiyyadi Nambiar community, a minuscule [[ambalavasi]] community living (basically) in three central Kerala districts of [[Thrissur]], [[Palakkad]] and [[Malappuram]].<ref>http://www.ayyappanthiyyattu.com/Ayya.htm#top</ref> The all-male art centres around the mythological story of the birth of Lord [[Ayyappa]] from the relationship of Lord [[Vishnu]] in his ephemeral impersonation as [[Mohini]] and Lord [[Shiva]].
The most common version of Thiyyattu involves four phases of presentation: a) Kalamezhuthu (sketching the kalam—picture—of Ayyappa using natural pigments), b) Kottum Pattum (rendition of invocatory songs of Ayyappa and a stylised narration of the story of his birth), c) Koothu [[gesture]]-laden dance enacting the build-up story to the delivery of the lord) and d) Velichchappaadu (the slow-paced to frenzied dance of the oracle who eventually erases the kalam—the image of the lord sketched on the sanctified floor). It takes roughly a couple of hours for the kalam (image) of the lord to be completed, after which the rest of the three rituals would consume nearly three hours altogether.
The picture of Ayyappa is sketched and embellished in five natural colours—white (rice powder), yellow (turmeric powder), green (ground semi-dry leaves of the 'vaaka' or manchadi' tree, red (a mix of turmeric powder and slaked lime) and black (powdered charred rice husk). The lord invariably holds his weapons like the sword and the bow-and-arrow, and, in more elaborate versions is sketched mounted on the tiger or the horse.
The songs—accompanied by the beats of 'para', a smaller version of the [[chenda]], and the cymbals called [[ilathalam]]—praising the lord bear a mix of quaint old [[Malayalam]] and [[Tamil language|Tamil]] with a streak of endemic tunes, some of which can be traced to classical [[raga]]s of the [[Sopanam]] style of Kerala music besides that belonging to the [[Carnatic music|Carnatic]] idiom. The stylised rendition of the birth of Ayyappa, called Thottam, also sticks to the same mix of languages, but is devoid of music.
The Koothu is enacted with no make-up but a defined set of costumes. Facial emotions are nil, dance movements are minimal and hand gestures would look the less refined versions of [[Koodiyattam]] and [[Kathakali]]. The Koothu is usually performed to the accompaniment of chenda, ilathalam and 'para'.
The Velichchappadu (oracle), wielding a small sword, is bare-chested but for the garland and, canonically, with a flowy hair; the face either bearded or clean-shaven. Around the waist, he is draped in cloth pieces of white and red colours. The oracle begins with slow steps while circumambulating around the 'kalam', but the tempo gains with the circles he make—around 9 or 11 of them, overall. Then he leaps onto the image in a frenzy, but is calm when he later erases the image with both legs. The face of the lord alone is erased with the (right) hand. Out from the 'kalam', the oracle utters 'revelatory' sentences in (presumed) trance -- 'kalpana' as they are called. The devotees are distributed with the [[prasadam]] which is the mixed powder used in the 'kalam'.
The art is sometimes staged in bigger forms that last from dawn to late night when it is called Udayasthamaya Thiyyattu. In such cases, the Koothu would deal with twelve stories ahead of the birth of Ayyappa. Such performances usually feature the challenging 'Pantheeraayiram', which is when the oracle would take a (three- to four-hour-long) break from the circumambulations to break (dehusked and sufficiently polished) coconuts totalling 12,000 to the rhythmic beats of chenda-and-ilathalam concert that would gain speed towards the climax.
The Thiyyadi Nambiar families, despite their existence in central Kerala, enjoy the popularity of their art more in the upstate [[Malabar (Northern Kerala)|Malabar]] belt. Some experts/historians trace this pattern to the community's possible southward flee from their original north Malabar homes during the controversial temple destruction spree of the 18th-century [[Mysore]] king [[Tippu Sultan]].Mulankunnathukavu Thiyyaadi Raman Nambiar,<ref>ayyappantheeyattu.com/mulankunnathukavu_thiyyadi.html</ref> in his book "'''Ayyappan Theeyattu'''"<ref>http://www.thehindu.com/books/books...the...ayyappan.../article5267634.ece</ref> gives a lively narration of the traditional art and acknowledges the support from [[V. R. Prabodhachandran Nayar]] in coming out with this invaluable narration of the age old [[Kerala]] art form.
==References== {{Reflist}} www.ayyappantheeyattu.com
==External links== *[http://www.ayyappanthiyyattu.com/Ayya.htm Ayyappan Thiyyattu] *[http://www.cyberkerala.com/theeyattu/index.html Bhadrakali Theeyattu]
watch bhadrakali theeyattu on YouTube. * https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qXokdLGXk1Q
watch bhadrakali theeyattu on googlevideo * http://video.google.com/videosearch?q=bhadrakali+theeyattu&sitesearch=#
